intro: Heliotropium inundatum f. ellipticum, commonly known as the broadleaf heliotrope, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
